title: How to Use a Custom Ringtone in Viber on Android

steps.title: Set a custom ringtone as your Android's default ringtone (optional).
steps.content: Set a custom ringtone as your Android's default ringtone (optional). You can skip this step if you want to use one of the built-in ringtones that came with your Android as your Viber ringtone. But if you want to use a song or tone you've downloaded or created , you'll need to make that sound your Android's default ringtone first. Open your Android's Settings. Tap Sounds and vibration . Tap Ringtone or Phone ringtone . [1] X Research source Depending on your Android, you'll now have to tap + or My Sounds to view the custom ringtones you've added. [2] X Research source Select the ringtone you want to use.

steps.title: Open the Viber app on your Android.
steps.content: Open the Viber app on your Android. The Viber app looks like a white phone icon in a purple speech bubble. If Viber opens to a conversation, tap the back arrow at the top-left to go back to your Chats list.

steps.title: Tap the More menu.
steps.content: Tap the More menu. You'll see this menu at the bottom-right corner of Viber.

steps.title: Tap Settings on the menu.
steps.content: Tap Settings on the menu. This is the option with the gear icon.

steps.title: Tap Notifications on the menu.
steps.content: Tap Notifications on the menu. This option has a bell icon.

steps.title: Scroll down and check the Use system sounds box.
steps.content: Scroll down and check the Use system sounds box. This option allows you to change Viber's default call and message notification tones.

steps.title: Tap Call ringtone.
steps.content: Tap Call ringtone . This opens a list of all the available ringtone sounds you can set as your new Viber ringtone.

steps.title: Select a new ringtone.
steps.content: Select a new ringtone. Scroll through the list, and tap the ringtone you want to set for your Viber calls. Once you choose a ringtone from the list, your change will take effect instantly. [3] X Research source If you changed your Android's ringtone to a custom sound, select Default ringtone to use that sound.
